BiblioData.Title: Polymer Devices
BiblioData.Abstract: A method for forming an electronic device having a region comprising a semiconductive polymer material, the method comprising depositing the semiconductive polymer by a process which promotes ordering in the deposited polymer.

Claims.P: 1. A method for forming an electronic device having a region comprising a semiconductive polymer material, the method comprising depositing the semiconductive polymer by a process which promotes ordering in the deposited polymer.
2. A method as claimed in claim 1, wherein the step of depositing the semiconductive polymer comprises dissolving the polymer in a solvent in which the polymer has a tendency to self-organise.
3. A method as claimed in claim 1 or 2, wherein the step of depositing the semiconductive polymer comprises coating the polymer from a solvent in which the polymer has a tendency to self-organise.
4. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 3, wherein the step of depositing the semiconductive polymer is performed in an inert atmosphere.

5. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 4, wherein the step of depositing the semiconductive polymer comprises preparing a substrate to promote the ordering of the polymer and depositing the polymer onto the substrate.
6. A method as claimed in claim 5, wherein the step of preparing the substrate comprises making the surface of the substrate more hydrophobic.
7. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 6, wherein the method comprises depositing at least one electrode over the semiconductive polymer.
8. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 7, wherein the polymer is a material that has a tendency to self-organise.
9. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 7, wherein the polymer has a conjugated backbone.
10. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 9, wherein the polymer has substituents either in or pendent from its backbone which promote ordering of adjacent polymer chains.
11. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 10, wherein the polymer has hydrophobic side-chains.
12. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 11, wherein the polymer is poly-hexylthiophene.
13. A method as claimed in any of claims 1 to 12, further comprising the step of forming a light-emissive device over the electronic device.
14. A method as claimed in claim 13, wherein the light-emissive device is integrated with the electronic device.

a current drive switching element having an input electrode, an output electrode, a switchable region comprising a semiconductive polymer material electrically coupled between the input electrode and the output electrode, and a control electrode electrically coupled to the switchable region so as to allow the application of a bias to the control electrode to vary the flow of current through the switchable region between the input electrode and the output electrode; and
a second circuit element, integrated with the switching element, and electrically coupled with the output electrode of the switching element for receiving a drive current from the switching element.
